[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Edge: Zero Address] [Special Values] Can TableHandle wrap the zero AccountAddress (0x0), and if so, does this cause special handling issues in table operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Edge: Max Address] [Boundary Testing] Does TableHandle properly handle the maximum AccountAddress value (all 0xFF), or can this cause integer overflow in address arithmetic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Edge: Empty TypeTag] [Validation] Can TableInfo be created with empty or null TypeTags for key_type or value_type, causing undefined behavior during table access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Upgrade: Serialization Format] [Migration Safety] If the serialization format of TableHandle or TableInfo changes in a protocol upgrade, are there safeguards to prevent breaking existing table data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Upgrade: Field Addition] [Schema Evolution] Can new fields be safely added to TableInfo in future versions without breaking deserialization of old state data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Gas: Serialization Cost] [Computational DoS] Can an attacker create TableInfo with extremely complex TypeTags that cause excessive gas consumption during serialization, enabling cheap DoS attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Performance: Hash Computation] [CPU Exhaustion] Does computing hashes for TableHandle involve expensive operations that could be abused to cause validator CPU exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Error: from_str()] [Error Handling] Are errors from from_str() properly propagated and handled, or can error swallowing hide invalid TableHandle creation attempts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Error: Panic Safety] [Unwrap Abuse] Does any code path using TableHandle or TableInfo use unwrap() or expect() that could cause validator panics on invalid input? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Crypto: Handle Randomness] [Entropy Source] Do TableHandles derived from AccountAddress have sufficient cryptographic randomness to prevent preimage attacks where attackers predict future handles? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Crypto: Collision Resistance] [Birthday Bound] At what scale does the AccountAddress space become vulnerable to birthday attacks, and could this enable table handle collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Access: Handle Forgery] [Authorization Bypass] Can an attacker forge a TableHandle without going through proper table creation flow, bypassing access control checks in table operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Access: Cross-Account] [Isolation Violation] Can a TableHandle created in one account's context be used to access tables in another account, violating account isolation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Integrity: TypeTag Validation] [Malformed Data] Does the system validate that key_type and value_type TypeTags are well-formed and safe before using them in table operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Integrity: Handle Validation] [Invalid Handles] Can TableHandles with invalid or reserved AccountAddress values bypass validation checks and corrupt state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [DoS: Mass Table Creation] [Resource Exhaustion] Can an attacker create unlimited TableHandles/TableInfos to exhaust storage or memory, even with gas limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [DoS: Complex Types] [Processing Cost] Can attacker create TableInfo with deeply nested TypeTags that cause excessive CPU usage during type resolution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Corruption: Partial Writes] [Atomicity] If a transaction partially updates TableInfo metadata, can this leave tables in corrupted state accessible to subsequent transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Corruption: Concurrent Modification] [TOCTOU] Can time-of-check-time-of-use races between TableInfo reads and writes cause state corruption during parallel execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [API: String Parsing] [Input Sanitization] Does from_str() properly sanitize input to prevent injection attacks when parsing AccountAddress strings? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [API: Error Messages] [Information Leak] Do parsing errors reveal internal system details that could aid attackers in reconnaissance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Storage: Key Construction] [Collision Attack] Can crafted TableHandles collide with system-reserved storage keys, allowing access to protected state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [Storage: Indexing] [Performance Degradation] Can adversarial TableHandle distribution cause pathological indexing performance in storage layer? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [VM: Type Resolution] [Resolution Failure] Can TableInfo with invalid TypeTags cause VM type resolution to fail, leaving tables inaccessible and funds locked? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/state_store/table.rs] [VM: Resource Semantics] [Capability Bypass] Can TableHandle be used as a capability to bypass Move's resource ownership model and access unauthorized tables? (Critical)
